intro: Polymniastrum urticifolium, commonly known as the stinging nettle tree, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the family Urticales and is characterized by its stinging hairs on its leaves, similar to common stinging nettle. The plant produces small, greenish flowers arranged in clusters, and its leaves are typically heart-shaped with a rough texture. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forest understories. The plant has been used in traditional medicine for its purported healing properties.
